results.title: Stress busters
results.brief_description: This presentation demonstrates Amanda Gore’s easy style of education and entertainment. Her unique humorous style, and passion for messages facilitates behavioural changes and creates rapport with any group, no matter what size. With a background in physiotherapy, psychology and neurolinguistics, she specialises in creativity and new ways of thinking, state of the art selling skils, lifestyle, communication, stress management and relationships. She talks about the how rather than the why, which gives people the skills and motivates them to make behavioural changes. Her constant research means every presentation is fresh. In this video Amanda aims to change your way of thinking about stress in the workplace and at home. She tries to make her audience see that it is a matter of attitude and know-how. This videotape was recorded at the FMRC (Financial Management Research Centre), Armidale, N.S.W. during a a Management Forum for Accountants in May 1993.

results.title: Stress and you: relaxation techniques (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Neil Mawby Productions and Herbert Long
results.brief_description: The human body is a complex network of rhythms that enable us to move grow and adapt. Only when we understand these rhythms can we understand stress and combat it accordingly. Biofeedback, relaxation response and meditation are demonstrated as means of reducing daily tension.

results.title: Stress and you: learning to cope (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Neil Mawby Productions and Herbert Long
results.brief_description: Recognition of stress as a health problem stemming from emotional or environmental pressures. Suggests ways of dealing with stressful situations, including a stress-reducing daily routine designed to avoid potential stress situations.

results.title: Stress and Tension
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
The causes and symptoms of stress are examined here, and we look at ways parents can stop feeling tired and run down. A variety of relaxation techniques are demonstrated, and we discuss ways of relieving loneliness. Mothers talk about the stress associated with trying to live up to other people’s expectations, especially when it comes to housework, and we provide hints on how to ease the housework load. Parents describe how they dealt with the anger they felt from the continual demands of their children, and we show how our parenting is influenced by the way we were brought up and what we can do to change it. There are hints on how to manage the end of the day and we discuss the value of your relationship with your partner in reducing stress.

results.title: Stress
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Ian MacNeill
results.brief_description: Dr. Hans Selye’s research and writings on the subject of stress are world-renowned. In this early documentary study, he is interviewed in his laboratories at the Universite de Montreal, where he explains his discoveries. Stress, the general strain on the body caused by disease, injury or mental pressure, is explained and we are shown some of the experiments that led Dr. Selye to his discovery.

results.title: Stress
results.creator_credit: Adolphe Viezzi, Adolphe Viezzi-Jean Ardy, Films de la Tour, FR3 and Jean-Louis Bertucelli
results.brief_description:
Nathalie lives with her young daughter in Paris. She is attempting to rebuild her life after her fiance was killed in suspicious circumstances. She starts to receive noxious phone calls, both at home and at work. Then, the heart of an ox, marked with her daughter’s name is deposited on her doorsteps.

Credits: Producer, Adolphe Viezzi ; director, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; writers, Jean-Louis Bertucelli, Andre Grall, Alain Demouzon ; photography, Ricardo Aronovich ; music, Paul Misraki.
Cast: Carole Laure, Guy Marchand, Andre Dussolier, Anne Meson, Germaine Montero.

results.title: Strengths and Weaknesses: College Students with Learn (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Four students share their experiences and feelings and four professionals explore possible adjustments and compensation relative to learning disabilities. The students emphasis on what they do provides optimistic prognosis for their academic survival.

results.title: Strength training for sport
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Isaacs, Paul Foxall and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”
The explosion of new athletic records has largely come about through strength training. The training program must strengthen all muscle groups. The various strength training techniques and exercises are demonstrated by top athletes.

results.title: Strength of the land
results.creator_credit: Alan Bateman, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This video follows the King of Thailand, Bhumibol Adulyadej, through his many personal and public activities, including his interest in science, agricultural engineering, the arts, and his tours of his country. Narrated by Keith Adam.
